page.title: 171984/85 Miners Strike
page.content: People were low on money,hardly any of them thought much of the police.They thought it was stupid the way the police hit pickets,so they started to call them{pigs.}The main thing they said was that they were low on clothes, but one said he had more during the strike.They were proud their dads had stuck out. One of them said that their mum supported the family.The word that was used most was {"SCAB".}One of the{stikebreakers}had scab written all over his house.Some children said that they worried when their dad's were on{picket.}Some of the children didn't even notice the strike was on.Some didn't think the strike would last so long.Some of the parents never went out unless it was a special occasion.The whole village turned out to see the{miners}return to work.{COMMENTS OF INTERVIEWED CHILDREN
